Text: The LORD is my shepherd; I shall not want.
Context: The psalmist expresses confidence and contentment in the LORD’s provision, akin to a sheep‘s trust in its shepherd.

Text: He makes me lie down in green pastures; He leads me beside quiet waters.
Context: Imagery of rest and nourishment; symbolizes God’s guidance to places of refreshing and safety.

Text: He restores my soul; He guides me in paths of righteousness for His name‘s sake.
Context: Indicates spiritual renewal and moral guidance, reflecting on God’s commitment to His own character and promises.

Text: Yea, though I walk through the valley of the shadow of death, I will fear no evil, for You are with me; Your rod and Your staff, they comfort me.
Context: The presence of potential danger with a strong assertion of divine comfort and protection.

Text: You prepare a table before me in the presence of my enemies. You anoint my head with oil; my cup overflows.
Context: Depicts God‘s provision and blessing in the face of opposition, along with an abundance that exceeds expectations.

Text: Surely goodness and mercy shall follow me all the days of my life, and I shall dwell in the house of the LORD forever.
Context: Expresses a confident expectation of ongoing divine goodness and an eternal relationship with God.
